alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County South Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 10 at 8:17PM PST until January 12 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet expected. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County South Coast. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on beaches with a west facing exposure, mainly near Rincon Point.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.
